banner.highlightMessage: A biblioteca js-ipfs ainda está em versão Alfa.
banner.message: O código ainda não foi validado por especialistas em segurança e não deve ser usado para guardar, partilhar ou publicar informação privada.

hero.textDescription: BR-js-ipfs paves the path for the Browser implementation of the IPFS protocol. Written entirely in JavaScript, it runs in a Browser tab, a Service Worker, a Web Extension and also in Node.js, opening the door to a world of possibilities.

features.sectionDesc: BR-Packed with all the things you know and love about IPFS, it also carries some extra neat things that are unique to the Browser. It's the toolkit to power all your DWeb Applications

list.title: BR-Run on Node.js and the Browser

list.title: BR-It can handle naming
list.desc: BR-It comes with IPNS, the Interplanetary Naming System, a way to author mutable pointers (records) so that you distribute updates in a authenticated and certified way.

list.title: BR-Install
list.desc: BR-This project is available through npm. To install run:
list.note: BR-Requires npm@3 and node@6 or above, tested on OSX & Linux, expected to work on Windows.

list.title: BR-Through command line tool
list.desc: BR-In order to use js-ipfs as a CLI, you must install it with the global flag. Run the following (even if you have ipfs installed locally):
list.note: BR-The CLI is available by using the command jsipfs in your terminal. This is aliased, instead of using ipfs, to make sure it does not conflict with the Go implementation.

list.title: BR-Use in the browser
list.desc:
BR-Learn how to bundle with browserify and webpack in the examples folder.

You can also load it using a <script> using the unpkg CDN or the jsDelivr CDN. Inserting one of the following lines will make a Ipfs object available in the global namespace.
list.note: BR-Inserting one of the above lines will make an Ipfs object available in the global namespace.

list.desc: BR-Browser extension that simplifies access to IPFS resources.
BR-The Decentralized WeTransfer. Filenation is the simplest way to send your files around the world using IPFS, it lets you send files as a link to an email using IPFS.

BR-PeerPad is a collaborative real-time editor that works on the decentralised web, built on top of IPFS and Y.js. It uses no second or third-party: all participating nodes talk directly to each other without a central service.

BR-Watch project updates, demos and other talks by the IPFS Community on the JavaScript project of IPFS. We will be adding dozens of more talks here soon from the IPFS Dev Meetings as soon as they are published.
BR-Paratii builds open source technology for video streaming and curation, with js-ipfs and Ethereum contracts. The Portal is a web app with curated crypto-related videos that runs on IPFS.
